image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Kanye West sued for sexually assaulting, strangling model in 2010: 'This is f**king art'
item.description: On camera, Kanye West began to choke her with one hand and then "wrapped his other hand around her neck and continued to strangle her with both hands". West smothered her face with both of his hands smearing her makeup. “He then rammed several fingers down her throat, continuously moved them in and out, and gagged her … to emulate forced oral sex,” the complaint further alleged.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: British teen Marcus Fakana held for sex with 17-year-old girl while holidaying in Dubai
item.description: An 18-year-old British tourist, Marcus Fakana, is facing potential jail time in Dubai for engaging in a relationship with a 17-year-old girl. Although the girl has since turned 18, their relationship began while she was still a minor under UAE law. Fakana was arrested after the girl's mother reported their relationship to Dubai authorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan issues special commemorative coin to mark Guru Nanak's 555th birth anniversary
Elon Musk was a flaming Democrat, says father. 'We fought over Trump in 2016'
item.description: ​Elon was a raging Democrat but now he is embracing his heritage and his destiny, his father said. "When you come from South Africa, Lefties think you're a Nazi. To succeed, you need to be accepted by them so my sons, [Elon and Kimbal], started to become these flaming liberals – turning away from South Africa and their roots, which included me."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy know many federal employees will quit because...
item.description: In their joint opinion piece for the Wall Street Journal, Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy explained how their Department of Government Efficiency will work and wrap up the work by July 4, 2026. ​"We are entrepreneurs, not politicians. We will serve as outside volunteers, not federal officials or employees. Unlike government commissions or advisory committees, we won’t just write reports or cut ribbons. We’ll cut costs," they wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pam Bondi says there is 'no legal basis' to keep names private in Jeffrey Epstein documents
item.description: Former Florida attorney general and Trump's nominee for US attorney General, Pam Bondi, has sparked controversy by advocating for the release of names from the Jeffrey Epstein case files. Bondi argues that concealing identities obstructs justice and shields potential wrongdoers. Her stance has ignited public debate, with some praising her transparency and others accusing her of political maneuvering.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Republican senators eager to see Tulsi Gabbard's FBI file because of her Snowden stance
item.description: Checking FBI files is a norm for all Cabinet nominees but for Tulsi Gabbard, the senators want to look if some previously unknown information, including possible foreign contacts, come out. As of now, however, they are treating Gabbard with deference and not criticizing her publicly. Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas), an Intelligence Committee member, said to Punchbowl that he has “no doubt that she’s a patriot,” but he wants to question Gabbard on her posture toward Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: MSNBC's Joy Reid says Trump govt would shoot Americans; gives Thanksgiving warning to Republicans
item.description: ​Joy Reid's on-air statement came as she issued a TikTok warning to Republican voters saying that their liberal friends may not welcome them on Thanksgiving because they are rightfully scared of those who voted for Trump. ​"You may want to step back and think about why people feel the way that they do...If you're sad that you're losing friends over this, I don't know what to tell you," the MSNBC host said to Republicans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend Grimes says he is 'not the man she fell in love with'
item.description: Grimes shared her struggle in detaching from Musk, whom she once described as the love of her life. She highlighted how his shift towards conservative political ideologies, including his contentious relationship with his transgender daughter, Vivian Jenna Wilson, has made him seem "unrecognizable" to her. The artist has been vocal in her support for Vivian, contrasting with Musk’s alleged actions that she finds difficult to reconcile with the person she once knew.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump's phone call to Matt Gaetz: 'You don't have the votes'
item.description: The real reason why Matt Gaetz withdrew his nomination for attorney general was a call from Donald Trump hours before Gaetz announced his decision. Despite lobbying efforts by Gaetz, Trump, and JD Vance, Gaetz lacked the necessary votes for confirmation. Gaetz stated his decision aimed to avoid distractions and ensure a swift transition for the Trump administration. Pam Bondi was nominated as his replacement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Elon Musk added 70 billion dollars to his wealth since Trump won
item.description: He might as well have been speaking about his new BFF and the nation’s first buddy Elon Musk who just can’t stop winning since Donald Trump came back to power. Elon Musk, already a dominant force in the business world, has now cemented his place in history as the wealthiest person ever. Thanks to a $70 billion surge in his net worth following Donald Trump's election victory, Musk’s fortune has soared to unparalleled levels, making him not only the richest individual alive but also the wealthiest ever tracked by Forbes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk reveals what he thinks about Epstein and Diddy files
item.description: Despite Donald Trump's alleged link to sex offender Epstein which the President-elect brushed aside, Donald Trump said he would be inclined to release all Epstein documents. Now the Republicans are pitching for the release of Diddy files. Elon Musk revealed his opinion on the release of both Epstein and Diddy files.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin: Russia may use new missile again after attack on Ukraine
item.description: Following Ukraine's use of US and UK-supplied missiles on Russian territory, Putin announced the successful test of a new missile, the Oreshnik, which was used to strike Dnipro. Putin emphasized that Russia possesses a stockpile of these missiles and has initiated mass production, indicating their potential use in future combat scenarios depending on perceived security threats to Russia.

item.title: Trump nominates hedge fund chief Scott Bessent to lead US treasury
item.description: Donald Trump has chosen Scott Bessent, a seasoned hedge fund manager, to lead the US Treasury in his second term. Bessent, known for his advocacy of Trump's economic policies, will be tasked with implementing a bold agenda that includes tax cuts, potential currency policy shifts, and navigating complex international economic diplomacy.

item.title: Daniel Penny opts not to testify as his defense rests in manslaughter trial: 'How much jury...'
item.description: Daniel Penny's defense team rested their case without the Marine veteran taking the stand in his manslaughter trial for the death of Jordan Neely. The defense highlighted Neely's outstanding arrest warrant and presented witnesses who described Neely's behavior on the subway as erratic and threatening.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Texas education board approves Bible-based curriculum for elementary schools
item.description: In a controversial move, the Texas State Board of Education approved new elective curriculum allowing Bible lessons in elementary schools. Supporters believe the Bible is crucial to American history, while critics argue it blurs the lines between religion and public education. This decision could potentially impact over 5 million students and set a precedent for other states.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US man receives 'life-changing' face transplant 10 years after suicide attempt: 'It was truly a miracle'
item.description: After surviving a suicide attempt a decade ago that left his face severely disfigured, a Michigan man has received a life-altering face transplant. Derek Pfaff, 30, underwent the 50-hour procedure at the Mayo Clinic, replacing most of his facial structure and restoring his ability to smell, swallow, and smile. The surgery, led by Dr.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy smiles, blows kiss to family in court, makes 3rd bail attempt
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs appeared in a Manhattan court for a third bail hearing, seeking release on a $50 million bond while awaiting trial on racketeering and sex-trafficking charges. Combs, who denies the allegations, has been jailed since September. Prosecutors allege witness tampering, while the defense decries the claims and challenges the seizure of Combs's handwritten notes from his jail cell.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Florida woman arrested for drowning and killing 14-year-old daughter in bathtub
item.description: A Florida woman, Kelsey Glover, is facing charges after allegedly drowning her 14-year-old daughter, Giselle, in a bathtub. Witnesses, including another child, reported seeing Glover holding Giselle underwater. Glover then allegedly attacked witnesses with a hammer. While currently charged with assault and battery, authorities are awaiting the medical examiner's report to potentially upgrade charges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk asks Donald Trump Jr how much MSNBC costs. X users say, 'We've been here before'
item.description: ​"How much it cost," Elon Musk replied and X users could not keep their calm. The screenshot of Elon Musk asking about the cost of then-Twitter in 2017 went viral. Meanwhile, Donald Trump Jr replied: "I mean it can't be much. Look at the ratings". ​Comcast recently announced plans to pin off cable networks including MSNBC and E! as their ratings dip. MSNBC, E!, CNBC, USA, Oxygen, SYFY and the Golf Channel will form part of a new, publicly traded company, while Comcast focuses on brands including NBC and Bravo, it announced.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
